basics.name: Christianne Young
basics.label: Engineering Student
basics.summary: I am currently a student at the University of Hawaii at Manoa majoring in Computer Engineering. My expected graduation is in Spring 2023 and following graduation I will be working in the space industry at Northrop Grumman.

courses: Basic Circuit Analysis I and II

work.summary: Help develop code for satellite's agents
highlights: Deliver 1U Artemis CubeSat kits to strategic partners
Document, test, and integrate the hardware and software of various sensors and components for the Artemis CubeSat Kit
Conduct outreach on behalf of the University of Hawai’i at Manoa College of Engineering (CoE)
Participate in the planning and hosting of CoE events
Troubleshooted issues with I2C on FPGAs
Developed an Android app to provide an efficient method for taking motor inventory
Researched an advanced security system utilizing geo-mapping software and various sensors
Presented projects to NIWC professionals and fellow interns

volunteer.organization: Aerospace Technologies Ke Ao Satellite Project: Team Laniakea
volunteer.position: Project Manager, On-Board Computer (OBC) Subsystem co-lead, and Communications Subsystem member
highlights: Ensure team’s milestones and CubeSat specifications are met
Write software for satellite’s computer and fabricate hardware for OBC
Utilize global network called SatNOGS to connect ground station to satellite

awards.title: Chancellor's Scholar
awards.summary: Scholarship of $10,000 a year (for 4 years) awarded to outstanding incoming freshmen.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students that earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more.
